importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the current state of the MLB postseason.
The scheduled start date of Game 1 of the World Series, marking the beginning of the final playoff stage between the Blue Jays and Dodgers.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe during which the ALCS and NLCS concluded, culminating in the Blue Jays' and Dodgers' respective playoff victories and qualification for the World Series.

keyTakeAways: The Toronto Blue Jays have won their first World Series berth in over 30 years after defeating the Seattle Mariners in seven games in the American League Championship Series.

The Los Angeles Dodgers, with the largest payroll in baseball, are the most successful franchise in recent years, having won two World Series titles and five National League pennants in the past nine seasons.
The Dodgers are aiming to become the first MLB team to win consecutive World Series titles in over 25 years, having won Game 4 of the NLCS with a dominant performance by Shohei Ohtani.
The Blue Jays' resurgence from a last-place finish in 2024 to a 94-68 record and a deep playoff run highlights their improved team performance and offensive power.
Despite a strong ALCS showing, Toronto narrowly won Game 7 after the Mariners committed key errors and allowed a late home run by George Springer.

The Blue Jays' success in the postseason — including a 34-run explosion against the Yankees — contrasts with the Dodgers' defensive and pitching superiority, though the Dodgers' bullpen has shown weakness.
Game 1 of the World Series is scheduled for Friday, October 24, in Toronto, marking a pivotal moment in the season's climax.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball (MLB) team based in Toronto, Canada.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are a key opponent in the World Series, having advanced to their first World Series appearance in over 30 years after defeating the Seattle Mariners in the ALCS.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball (MLB) team based in Los Angeles, California.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the primary opponent in the World Series and represent the most successful and financially dominant team in recent MLB history.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball (MLB) team based in Seattle, Washington.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners were the Blue Jays' opponent in the ALCS and are noted as the only MLB franchise to have never reached the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A two-way superstar player for the Los Angeles Dodgers, known for his abilities as both a batter and pitcher.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani delivered a historic performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, with three home runs and 6.1 shutout innings, contributing to the Dodgers’ playoff success.

namedEntities.name: George Springer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A key player for the Toronto Blue Jays, known for his offensive contributions.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Springer hit a decisive three-run home run in Game 7 of the ALCS, which ended the Mariners’ hopes and sealed the Blue Jays’ series win.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays, who spoke post-game about the team’s resilience during the ALCS.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hoffman’s commentary highlights the team's perseverance and close performance throughout the ALCS, particularly in the decisive Game 7.

namedEntities.name: American League Championship Series (ALCS)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The playoff series determining the American League representative for the World Series.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays won the ALCS against the Mariners in seven games, securing their spot in the World Series.

namedEntities.name: National League Championship Series (NLCS)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The playoff series determining the National League representative for the World Series.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers swept the Milwaukee Brewers in the NLCS, demonstrating their postseason dominance.

namedEntities.name: World Series
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The championship series of Major League Baseball, pitting the AL and NL champions against each other.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays and Dodgers are set to face each other in the World Series, marking a major moment in MLB history.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A two-way superstar player for the Los Angeles Dodgers, known for his abilities as both a batter and pitcher.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani delivered a historic performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, with three home runs and 6.1 shutout innings, contributing to the Dodgers’ playoff success.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball (MLB) team based in Seattle, Washington.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners were the Blue Jays’ opponent in the ALCS and are noted as the only MLB franchise to have never reached the World Series.

namedEntities.name: New York Yankees
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball (MLB) team based in New York, New York.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Yankees were the Blue Jays' division rival in the ALDS, where the Blue Jays’ offense overwhelmed them with 34 runs over four games.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Phillies
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball (MLB) team based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Phillies were defeated by the Dodgers in the NLDS, managing only one win in the series.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball (MLB) team based in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers were swept by the Dodgers in the NLCS, marking a key step in the Dodgers' postseason run.

namedEntities.name: Pittsburgh Pirates
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball (MLB) team based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Pirates defeated the Dodgers in a September sweep, highlighting a period of inconsistency in the Dodgers’ regular season.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays, after a dramatic seven-game victory over the Seattle Mariners in the ALCS, have advanced to the World Series for the first time since 1993. They will face the Los Angeles Dodgers, who have dominated the postseason with a record of two World Series titles and five NL pennants in the past nine seasons. The Dodgers, led by the extraordinary performance of Shohei Ohtani, swept the Milwaukee Brewers in the NLCS and are aiming to become the first team in 25 years to win back-to-back World Series titles. The Blue Jays’ strong offensive showing, including a 34-run explosion against the Yankees in the ALDS, contrasts with the Dodgers’ defensive and pitching superiority, though the Dodgers’ bullpen has shown vulnerabilities. Game 1 of the World Series is set for Friday, October 24, in Toronto, marking a pivotal moment in the 2025 MLB postseason.
title: Dodgers and Blue Jays Set for World Series Clash in 2025
